source: 一九九三年的那个冬天，对我来说最重要的事，是我爸爸回来了，就在我妈结婚前的那个星期。十二月的一个下午，他到学校来找我。我一路飞奔向大门口，隔着铁栏杆远远地看到他站在外面抽烟。身上穿着一件黑色长风衣，竖起的领子遮住了半张脸。不知道为什么，连他的样子也没有看清，就觉得他过得似乎很不好。我的心一酸，眼泪掉了出来。
translation: The most important thing for me that winter of 1993 was the return of my father, just a week before my mother's wedding. On a December afternoon, he came to the school to find me. I ran all the way to the entrance and saw him standing outside smoking, separated by the iron fence. He wore a long black windbreaker, with the collar raised to cover half his face. I don't know why, but even without seeing his face clearly, I had a feeling that he wasn't doing well. My heart ached and tears welled up.

source: 我没想过我妈妈会有再婚的念头。或许潜意识里，我觉得她应该因为我爸爸的离开而一直痛苦下去，就像我一样。况且，我觉得她缺少那种找到幸福的能力。事实也许的确如此，可是幸福有能力找到她。不是吗，作为一个美人，根本不必那么辛苦，她什么都不用做，只要站在原地就好了。
translation: I never thought my mother would have the idea of remarrying. Perhaps deep down, I felt that she should continue to suffer because of my father's departure, just like me. Moreover, I feel that she lacks the ability to find happiness. Maybe that's true, but happiness has the ability to find her. Isn't that right? As a beauty, she didn't need to work hard at all. She didn't have to do anything, just stand in one place.

source: 我还记得，那一年的冬天特别长，四月过了一半，迎春花还没有开。父母离婚的事，令你的情绪很消沉。我们好久都没有什么新游戏了，一到傍晚就百无脚赖地坐在死人塔的房顶上。院子里散落的那些身体部件中，又多了几只胳膊。我们用钩子把它们拨到一起，摆成了一个千手观音。
translation: I still remember, that winter was particularly long; by mid-April, the flower of early spring had not yet bloomed. The divorce of your parents has made you very depressed. We haven't had any new games for a long time. In the evening, we would sit aimlessly on the rooftop of the Tower of the Dead. There were a few more arms scattered among the body parts in the courtyard. We hooked them together and arranged them into a thousand-armed Guanyin.

source: 我爸爸其实对做生意一窍不通，只是去投奔一个并不相熟的表哥。我奶奶有个妹妹，早年去了北京，后来在那里结婚生子。这个表哥是她家的长子，在整个家族里，一直作为一个异类存在。
translation: My father actually had no idea how to do business and went to seek refuge with a cousin who wasn't familiar at all. My grandmother had a younger sister who went to Beijing at a young age and later got married and had children there. This cousin is the eldest son of her family and has always been seen as an outsider in the entire clan.

source: 刚才你说每个人都有一个起运的时间，人生好像忽然套上了缰绳。我的应该是在八岁。那年秋天，爸爸离开济南，一个人去了北京。从那以后，我就再也没有家了。
translation: Just now, you said that everyone has a time of good fortune, and it feels like life suddenly becomes constrained. I should have been around eight years old. That autumn, my dad left Jinan and went to Beijing alone. Since then, I no longer had a home.

source: 我并不打算赴约。不管是因为什么，我想我们都没有再见面的必要了。我坐在沙发上一支一支地抽烟，天色越来越暗，门突然笃笃地敲响了。送水的男孩扛着水桶站在门囗，说是给西郊的一户人家送水去了。他戴着一顶脏兮兮的灰色毛线帽子，神情恍惚。
translation: I have no intention of keeping the appointment. For whatever reason, I don't think there's a need for us to meet again. I sat on the sofa, smoking one cigarette after another. The sky grew darker and suddenly there was a knocking sound at the door. Farewell. The water boy stood at the door holding a bucket of water, saying that he was delivering water to a household in the western suburbs. He was wearing a dirty grey knitted hat and had a vacant expression.

source: 我们的谈话进行得很艰难。每次陷入沉默，我都觉得心脏受到压迫，只想快点结束这次见面。你似乎有所察觉，但还在努力寻找话题。茶冷下去，屋子里的白雾已经散尽，你终于起身告辞。我刚关上门，感觉松了一囗气，门铃又响了。你站在门囗，请我晚些到小白楼来。我还没有来得及推辞，你已经走出了楼洞。
translation: Our conversation was very difficult. Every time I fell into silence, I felt my heart being squeezed, and I just wanted to end the meeting as soon as possible. You seem to have noticed something, but you are still trying to find a topic. The tea has turned cold, and the white mist in the room has dissipated. You finally get up to bid farewell. I had just closed the door and felt relieved, when the doorbell rang again. You stand at the door and invite me to come to Xiaobailou later. I haven't had time to refuse, and you've already walked out of the corridor.

source: 我走到厨房关掉炉子。水已经蒸发了半壶，整个房间弥漫在白雾里。你局促地坐下来，看着我倒茶。 "你还跟奶奶和姑姑一起住吗？"你问。 我告诉你，奶奶已经去世了，现在我和姑姑一起生活。 "她一直没成家" 你问。 "嗯。"
translation: I walked to the kitchen and turned off the stove. Half of the pot had evaporated, and the entire room was filled with white mist. You sit down awkwardly and watch as I pour the tea. "Do you still live with your grandmother and aunt?" You ask. I'll tell you, Grandma has passed away, and now I live with my aunt. "She never got married," you ask. "Um."

source: 你嘴巴里呼出的白色哈气，被风撩起的卷曲头发，大衣下摆底下微微颤动的膝盖，这些让我相信眼前的你是真实的存在，并非是先前那个梦的延续。十八年没见了，认不出来也不奇怪。你没有化妆，苍白的脸有一点浮肿，不过总算没有辜负大家的期望，长成了一个美人。只是那张桃心小脸乌戚戚的，一副在大都市待久了的神情。你问我，你的样子是不是和我想象的不一样。我不置可否地笑了笑。坦白说，我从未想象过你长大之后的样子。对我而言，和你有关的一切都已经装进档案袋，封上了火漆。说出来或许会有些伤人吧，不过，我真的没有期待与你再见面。
translation: The white breath that escapes from your mouth, the curly hair that is tousled by the wind, the slightly trembling knees underneath your coat—these make me believe that you are a real presence in front of me, and not just a continuation of the dream I had before. It's not surprising that I couldn't recognize him after 18 years of not seeing him. You didn't wear any makeup, your pale face was slightly swollen, but at least you lived up to everyone's expectations and grew into a beautiful woman. But her small heart-shaped face wore a mournful expression, as if she had spent a long time in the city. You ask me if your appearance is different from what I imagined. I smiled without giving a direct answer. To be honest, I never imagined what you would look like when you grew up. As far as I'm concerned, everything related to you has been packed into a file and sealed with wax. It might hurt someone's feelings to say it out loud, but I really didn't expect to see you again.

source: 我睁开眼睛。你站在门囗。我不知道你已经站了多久，没准连我在梦里大笑都看到了。还有醒来的悲伤，最虚弱时刻的样子。程恭，你低声喊出我的名字，声音非常沙哑，似乎已经很久没有开囗讲过话。快要下雪了，天阴得厉害，屋子里黑漆漆的。炉子上的水沸了，咕嚕噜地翻滚着。我仔细地看了你一会儿，确信自己并不认识你。可是在昏暗的光线里，我忽然觉得这个站在对面的陌生人，似乎与我的生命有很深的联结。那种感觉让人背后一阵发凉。我努力回想着，记忆的卡片在头脑中晔啦晔啦地翻动。然后你说，你是李佳栖。
translation: I opened my eyes. You are standing at the door. I don't know how long you've been standing there, maybe you even saw me laughing in my dream. There is the sadness that awakens, the look of vulnerability in its weakest moments. Cheng Gong, you whispered my name, your voice so hoarse as if you hadn't spoken in a long time. It's about to snow, and the sky is extremely dark. The house is pitch black. The water on the stove came to a boil, bubbling and churning. I looked at you carefully for a while and confirmed that I didn't actually know you. But in the dim light, I suddenly felt a deep connection between this stranger standing across from me and my own life. That feeling gives people a chilling sensation. I tried hard to recall, flipping through the memory cards in my mind. And then you said, "You're Li Jiaqi."
